metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12761 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A code injection issue was discovered in PyXDG before 0.26 via crafted Python code in a Category element of a Menu XML document in a .menu file. XDG_CONFIG_DIRS must be set up to trigger xdg.Menu.parse parsing within the directory containing this file. This is due to a lack of sanitization in xdg/Menu.py before an eval call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-xdg - 0.25-4ubuntu0.16.04.1
python3-xdg - 0.25-4ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> needs to be parsing untrusted menu files

criterions.comment: pyxdg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.25-4ubuntu0.16.04.1').
